title: A Guide To Angelina Jolie's Kids And Every Time They Won The Red Carpet
text:
From ELLE

Angelina Jolie has had many a show-stopping red carpet moment.

From the the satin and sheer slip dresses of the Nineties and the leg-popping Atelier Versace moment of 2012 Oscars to the Saint Laurent deconstructed tuxedo at the 2014 BAFTA Awards, and her most recent appearances wearing spookily embellished gowns for the Maleficent 2 publicity tour, Jolie commands a red carpet camera like no other.

Since becoming a mother, it's now not unusual for the actress to bring along her brood of six children to premieres, award ceremonies and charity galas.

Here are all the times Angelina Jolie's kids have scrubbed up and won the red carpet just like their mother always has, with a brief introduction to the large family.

Angelina Jolie's children

Angelina Jolie has six children: Maddox, Pax, Zahara, Shiloh and twins Knox and Vivienne.

In her exclusive essay for ELLE's September issue this year, Jolie wrote of her pride for her children.

'I could not be prouder of my sons for the men they are becoming, the way they respect their sisters and are respected by them...,' she penned.

'I often tell my daughters that the most important thing they can do is to develop their minds. You can always put on a pretty dress, but it doesn’t matter what you wear on the outside if your mind isn’t strong. There is nothing more attractive – you might even say enchanting – than a woman with an independent will and her own opinions.'

Maddox Jolie-Pitt

Photo credit: J. Merritt - Getty Images More

Maddox is Angelina's first child, who she adopted from Cambodia in 2002 when he was seven months old. Now, 18, he recently enrolled at university in Seoul, South Korea - something Jolie said makes her so proud of him.

'I feel my world expands as their world expands, I'm excited. Maddox was so ready,' she told ET.

Pax Jolie-Pitt

Photo credit: Michael Kovac - Getty Images More

Fifteen-year-old Pax was adopted by Jolie from Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam when he was three years old in 2007. The teen attended the 2018 Golden Globes with his mother last year.

Zahara Jolie-Pitt

Photo credit: Karwai Tang - Getty Images More
